title: How to Farm Herba Mystica in Pokémon Scarlet & Violet

steps.title: Launch Pokémon Scarlet or Violet.
steps.content: Launch Pokémon Scarlet or Violet. For a limited time, Nintendo is giving out a random Sweet or Spicy Herba Mystica via Mystery Gift. This Mystery Gift expires on September 30, 2024.

steps.title: Open the Code screen.
steps.content: Open the Code screen. Tap X and navigate to PokéPortal > Mystery Gift > Get with Code/Password . You'll have to connect to the internet to get this Mystery Gift.

steps.title: Enter the password SWEET0RSP1CY.
steps.content: Enter the password SWEET0RSP1CY . The Herba Mystica will arrive in your game. Make sure to save your game after obtaining the Herba Mystica so you don't lose it.

steps.title: Defeat Tera Raid Pokémon that give out multiple Herba Mystica types.
steps.content: Defeat Tera Raid Pokémon that give out multiple Herba Mystica types. There are a number of Pokémon that are Tera Raid Bosses who have a chance of giving out multiple types of Herba Mystica . This will increase your chances of getting an Herba Mystica as a drop, but technically speaking, all Tera Raid Battles have a chance to give at least one type of Herba Mystica as a reward. [1] X Research source [2] X Research source In the base game, the following 5-Star Tera Raid Boss Pokémon can give multiple types of Herba Mystica as a reward: Gengar, Blissey, Glalie, Drifblim, Amoonguss, Eelektross, Palafin, Cetitan, and Dondozo In the Teal Mask DLC, the following 5-Star Tera Raid Boss Pokémon can give multiple types of Herba Mystica as a reward: Snorlax, Dusknoir, Mandibuzz, and Basculegion In the Indigo Disk DLC, the following 5-Star Tera Raid Boss Pokémon can give multiple types of Herba Mystica as a reward: Lapras, Kingdra, and Malamar In the base game, the following 6-Star Tera Raid Boss Pokémon can give multiple types of Herba Mystica as a reward: Vaporeon, Blissey, Amoonguss, Cetitan, Dondozo, and Farigiraf In the Teal Mask DLC, the following 6-Star Tera Raid Boss Pokémon can give multiple types of Herba Mystica as a reward: Poliwrath, Snorlax, and Basculegion In the Indigo Disk DLC, the following 6-Star Tera Raid Boss Pokémon can give multiple types of Herba Mystica as a reward: Slowbro, Muk, Lapras, Kingdra, Porygon2, and Malamar

steps.title: Finish the game.
steps.content: Finish the game. The first step to unlocking 5- and 6-Star Tera Raid Battles is to finish Pokémon Scarlet or Violet. These raids are high-end endgame content, so you'll need to be sufficiently prepared before you take one on.

steps.title: Complete the Academy Ace Tournament.
steps.content: Complete the Academy Ace Tournament. After finishing the game, you'll have to defeat all the gym leaders again before competing in the Academy Ace Tournament. You'll be prompted to start this quest when you're being congratulated in Clavell's office after finishing the main story. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Host and complete 5-Star Tera Raids.
steps.content: Host and complete 5-Star Tera Raids. During the post-game, Instructor Jacq will call to let you know that 5-Star Tera Raid Battles are available, but will caution you to not do 6-Star Raids yet. You can attempt 6-Star Raids despite his warning (denoted by their black raid crystal) or you can keep doing 5-Star Raids until Jacq tells you to attempt 6-Star Raids.
